result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frankie Vernon Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Scheduling Conference. 
NEW TIME: Scheduling Conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom video Conference.
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Hanrahan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Feiss, Br. 46.

Defendant Frankie Vernon Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Frankie Vernon Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Stirmel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frankie Vernon Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Frankie Vernon Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. Subpoena was never received. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. Court acknowledges the motion. Motion is denied. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4.

Defendant Frankie Vernon Lewis in Court, in custody.  Attorney Meera Al-Henaey in Court for Frankie Vernon Lewis. Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion for Modification of Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED State's Motion for Modification of Bail. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Flaherty contacted Branch 46 and Attorney Al-Henaey to schedule Bail/Bond hearing. 
Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09;30 am.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Notice of State's Objection to Bail Set in ICCR and Request for Immediate Relief; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Frankie V L Jr.
AL (Minor Child 3/4/08)
CL (Minor Child 7/2/07)
TL (Minor Child 12/12/04)
Larshelle L S. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frankie Vernon Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Frankie Vernon Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
In Person Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
